name: Customer.io
description: Supercharge your email engagement in Customer.io

private_settings.name: synchronized_segments
private_settings.title: User Filter
private_settings.description: Send users to Customer.io when belonging to one of these segments. By default, no user is sent

private_settings.name: enable_user_deletion
private_settings.title: Enable User Deletion
private_settings.description: If this field is enabled, users who don't match the Segments above will be DELETED from Customer.io. Otherwise they will be ignored

private_settings.name: events_filter
private_settings.title: Events Filter
private_settings.description: Send these events to Customer.io. By default, no event is sent.

private_settings.name: anonymous_events
private_settings.title: Send Anonymous Events
private_settings.description: Send events for users that don't have an email. This is an advanced option. Check our docs for more infos

private_settings.name: user_id_mapping
private_settings.title: customerId mapping
private_settings.description: Customer.io requires a unique main identifer for each user called `customerId`. The best practice is to use the `external_id` because it can never change, but in specific cases you might want to use another attribute. This is an advanced setting. We advise to contact us before changing.

private_settings.name: synchronized_attributes
private_settings.title: Attribute List
private_settings.description: List the attributes to send to Customer.io. We automatically send the Email, the customerId (as mapped above) and an attribute called `hull_segments` that contains the names of all the segments the User belongs to

json.name: credentials
json.title: Customer.io Webhook url
json.description: In **Customer.io**, go to **Integrations** then **Reporting Webhooks**, create or edit one and paste at the following url in `WEBHOOK ENDPOINT`. If you aren't seeing the **Reporting Webhooks** category, please have a look at the documentation tab

settings_sections.title: Credentials
settings_sections.description:
This section authorize connector against Customerio.io API. Two API credentials are needed to enable outgoing traffic, additional webhook url can be added in Customer.io settings to enable incoming events.

To get `SITE ID` and `API KEY` go to **Customer.io**, then **Integrations** and select **Customer.io API**, credentials are available at the top of the screen.
To enable incoming events copy the webhook url below and in **Customer.io**, go to **Integrations** and find **Email Activity Webhook**. Then paste at the url in `WEBHOOK ENDPOINT`
